column4:
QuizzLand is the entertainment trivia game where you get unlimited questions that can‚Äôt be found anywhere else. 

Install QuizzLand and answer trivia questions, read interesting explanations, educate yourself!

Just your brain and our quizzes. No need to wait for other players' replies! 

Available in 17 languages: English, Spanish, Portuguese, Dutch, Swedish, Korean, Japanese, Italian, Polish, Turkish, Chinese, German, Russian, Indonesian, Czech, Vietnamese and Hindi.

Earn coins for correct answers and spend them on hints for the most challenging questions.

Join the league of top players and collect achievements of all kinds.

Invite friends and get rewarded! 


QuizzLand is:
-free trivia game to test your IQ and general knowledge
-source of valuable and little-known information
-entertaining questions for all categories of interest
-a great opportunity to challenge your friends and other players for top ranks
-delightful learning experience whether you know the answers or not
-detailed explanation for every question


QuizzLand makes learning easy and fun!


*******************************
How to play

-check your knowledge: answer questions, read descriptions for correct answers and compete with other players.
-to complete a level, you have to find the exit in a trivia maze. 
-you get points for each question answered correctly. If you give a wrong answer, no points are added to your account. Moreover, each wrong answer takes one of your lives. Your lives are displayed in the top left corner of the screen.
-if you continue playing after finding the exit, you will get more points for each question answered correctly. 

Questions:

-all questions are filtered by difficulty. The more questions you answer, the more difficult questions you get. The difficulty of a question is indicated by white scales under each question. 
-you get more points for difficult questions.

Coins and lives:

Coins are the in-game currency used in QuizzLand. Use coins to buy lives, hints and other useful options.
-if you want a larger amount of coins, you can make such a purchase in QuizzLand Store. To open the Store, tap on the cart icon in the top right corner of the screen.
-earn coins without buying them: collect you daily coin bonus, watch suggested videos or get coins by playing mini-games inside the maze. 
-you also get coins once the level is completed. In this case, the number of coins depends on how many questions you answered correctly.
-your lives refill in a few minutes but you can also get them faster for coins. You can also get lives if you watch a suggested video.

Question hints:

‚ÄúDouble Chance‚Äù - activate the hint, then choose the answer. If it is incorrect, then you'll be able to try to answer again.
‚ÄúFifty Fifty‚Äù -  eliminate two incorrect answers in a question.
‚ÄúMajority Vote‚Äù - see what answer option the majority of players have chosen.
‚ÄúSkip Question‚Äù - activate the hint to skip a question and answer another instead.

Map hints:

‚ÄúShow Exit‚Äù can be used to find the exit from the maze.
‚ÄúFlip Tile‚Äù allows you to flip any of the unopened questions.
‚ÄúOpen Map‚Äù will flip all the tiles in the maze at once.

Mini memory games:
-play bonus memory games and earn more points. These brain games were created to train your concentration, memory and attention skills.
-you can finish a memory game any time you like, however if you do it before the time is out, your reward will be smaller.

column35: ['So good a bit it is difficult part of this game, but it is raised my desire in my body cause fun', 'Bad English, many incorrect answers and very advertisement heavy.', "I like this app! I can just learn so much with this! Just one problem though; Mount Everest isn't actually the highest mountain in the world. Mauna Kea is, about 1.5x higher than Mount Everest.", 'Need updates for new backgrounds and characters', 'This game is sooo fun you should really give it a try', 'The game itself is novel and fun. The characters are whimsical and the basic premise are all great. The problem comes with the English translation of many of the questions. "Do snails not have teeth?" Try figuring out the grammar. Yes or no really could defensibly work here because of the way English handles double negatives and it\'s that nuance that ruins the whole experience for me. Of it were translated more consistently I would highly recommend it.', "Now that I can move my person back and forth, I think its a pretty cool game. The only complaint I have are the answers to some of the questions. You think you are answering it right (and you are by the wsy you look at the question) and it ends up being wrong. I think there might be a language translation barriar? And I really don't believe you are always playing against other people either. Nonw the less its kinda fun.", "Theoretically this game could be a lot of fun, if it were not for the fact that the questions themselves are all either horribly written or wrong. At least 5 of the last 10 questions I got were grammatically so bad there was no way to answer them. Things like double and triple negatives, or questions to which T or F were awkward answers. Theres no way to report or flag them either so I assume they'll never not disappear again for the first time or reappear not then but in the now. /s", "Love the idea. What I just hate is you playing with bots, not with real people. It didn't make any intense in game....", 'Fairly fun game, with a decent concept and execution. However, it has two major flaws that prevent a higher rating: Firstly, the battle royale format of having 100 characters whittled down to one by successive elimination implies that it\'s a multiplayer game. In actuality, all of the "competitors" are quite obviously AI. There is no competitive multiplayer at all, which takes a lot of the the fun out for me personally. Secondly, a lot of the questions are poorly worded or have mistakes.', 'Fun, but some questions are wrong or worded funny. For example, One question asked "Are there 5 players in a basketball game?" The obvious answer is no, because both teams need an even number of players, and professional games have 2 teams of 5 players (on the court). So I chose false... and got it wrong. The explanation was "A basketball team has 5 players." But that wasn\'t the question that was asked...', 'Decently fun game, but i have a couple issues with it. A couple questions make some claims that are not proven. One says "cow farts and burps are the cause of global warming." There is no definitive proof as to the cause of global warming. Also, many questions have double negatives and it can be exhausting to figure out the correct answer. Good concept, poor execution.', "I love the idea. It's generally fun to play and, and the unlocks are well done. That being said, they struggle with the core of the game: trivia. You'll learn something from one question and apply it to another only for them to tell you you're wrong, yet you used the correct answer on another question to answer it. Further investigation shows that many of their answers just aren't correct. I can't give a trivia game with inaccurate trivia a good rating.", 'Game is complete garbage. The concept is great, but, when you have incorrect trivia in a trivia game, the "trivia" aspects fall apart. For example: A question asked, "Did the same person who invented the light bulb also invent the electric chair?". Which is of course false, but the devs are convinced that Harold Brown invented both. Harold Brown invented neither one of those things! Don\'t make a trivia game if you don\'t know trivia.', 'Many of these questions are flat out wrong or too vague. I think this is because of poor translation by the game developers. One question says that fleas have wings. THEY DO NOT. Maybe they mistranslated fleas from "flies?" Next, many of the questions are just vague. One of them asked "Did war break out during the world cup?" Which war? Which world cup? What year? These questions need to be fixed or have an option to report them for having issues.', 'this game is a fun concept but it falls short on so many levels. there are many, many questions in here that are answered incorrectly. (For example, there is one that says: are spiders insects. The answer is no, however it says the answer is yes and then tells you that spiders are arachnids... arachnids are animals not insects.) there are also a large amount of the questions that are worded in confusing ways, and many more questions that are just impossible to know. Uninstalled', "Fun idea but so many incorrect questions. For example 'Goldfish do not sleep'. The game said this was true but it is not. Goldfish do sleep whilst not in the same way we do it is certainly considered sleep. Also a lot of the questions are worded in a way that the answer become obvious even if you didn't know the answer. Also the game doesn't have much progression. One can unlock the final stage quite quickly and can already see a repititon of questions.", "‚ö†cannot play other sounds (i.e. music) from other app while playing this game‚ö†. it's a trivia machine, obviously, with cute and funny graphics. However, the questions are often lost in translation. I can understand this because the developer is not native English. Also a lot of the questions are within Asian culture context. Please do improve.", "I really like this game--it's silly and fun. My only real gripe is that not all the questions and answers are worded in a way that makes sense. At best, it causes confusion and at worst, makes some answers technically incorrect. Unfortunately, I can't find a way to flag these awkward questions/answers. With a little grammatical revision, I'd totally give a higher score!", 'It was fun at first, but some of the questions are too ambiguous. "Can a lion\'s roar be heard a mile away?" the game said this was wrong, and that it can be heard 5 miles away. So doesn\'t that mean you can definitely hear that a mile away? Too ambiguous. Otherwise good game design, nice graphics. Please improve on the quality of your trivia. I\'ve noticed a few scientific ones that were very dubious, but cannot remember off the to of my head.', 'Too many errors in translation. It will ask you oddly worded questions or just mark you wrong for answering the question correctly. It is a neat game, but when one of the features of the game is to unlock new characters, and some of those are locked behind winning rounds consecutively, it makes it impossible when there are errors in your questions.', 'This is a fun game, but you need someone to better check your questions. I look up each answer I get wrong to enlighten myself, but sometimes I lose on questions even though I\'m correct. For example, "A bee flaps its wings 11000 times per SECOND." This is false, but the game says it\'s TRUE. A bee can flap its wings up to 230 times per second, or over 11000 times per MINUTE.', 'This game was interesting when it was 1 vs 10, 50 and 100 it was pretty good! :) But when it got to individual, it got kind of boring. All i suggest is add more mini games so that you could improve your game and have more 5 star reviews! :) i think i didnt play properly. but this is a nice game! i got some more information. Thank you!', 'Poor grammar, which is challenging in a timing based game when you have to double check you understand the question. Also, the questions aren\'t always factual, or the wording makes it very misleading. For example, a question they gave was "Cows burps and farts are the cause of global warming." Its misleading because they are not *the* single cause of global warming, nor are they the leading cause of global warming. The game reminds me of one I played as a kid on the Wii, but poorly executed.', 'More time is spent watching ads than actually "playing" the game, if you can call it gameplay. All you do is move your avatar to the Yes or No options and pray you don\'t get killed. As other reviews suggest, the answers are not always correct, so it really is a random draw. Outside of unlocking other avatars there isn\'t much replay value to this.', 'This is a nice game. It\'s well put together and looks nice. However, a lot of the questions are worded poorly or just incorrect. :/ For example: 1) Do such and such type of owl hunt during the day? App answer: No, they are nocturnal. Actuality: they do sometimes hunt during the late day. true, they primarily do not, but not always. 2) "Something-or-other" is the Indian word for -something-else- app: yes, it is problem: Indian? Did you mean Hindi, Bengali, Telugu? Or maybe native American? :/', "Seemed cool, then found out it wasn't online. The AI can be pretty dumb, they get an answer right then the same exact question appears again and they change their minds and get it wrong. The choices of the AI is completely random, so it isn't really a challenge. Then I found out you just get the same questions on repeat. Game was fun for about 20 mins, then you've basically done everything.", 'Great premise, but Please troubleshoot trivia accuracy. Fleas do not have wings. Nothing more frustrating than playing a trivia game that\'s wrong about its questions. Thanks. Also frustrating... question is "Is Portuguese the official language of 10 countries?" select yes, die. Death message states "Portuguese is the official language of 10 countries." So i was right and lost anyway. No more for me, thanks.', "okay, there are a lot of questions on there that are misleading or literally straight up wrong. grammar is an issue (I'd assume because it was translated), and it is not an online game. its singleplayer. I feel like a lot of 'facts' in here are from either memes or a quick little google search and there really aren't that many questions. played for like 20 mins and got repeats ones. I mean I'll give them credit for trying, but it's not a game that they put a whole lotta care into.", "i love this game. simple and informative. i feel smarter. haha. the characters are very cute. i lobe to collect them all. however i have to uninstall it because i think the moving graphic from the characters like they are running seem too fast. my eye was distracted and very disturbed that it feel pain. other than that, there is a question about male mosquito suck blood. i had to answer 'o' to pass the question. overall, this is a fun game.", "Broken answers about 10-20% of the time. The wording is mostly the problem, factually it seems to be accurate but the game triggers a lot of does and does not questions which end up flipping the meaning of the answer the wrong way and the game doesn't acknowledge that you have chosen correctly. Also in about 20% of the times I lose, the answer I chose was exactly the answer the game states as correct. It is fun other than that and visually appealing with all the different characters.", 'A fun concept and I do enjoy playing. Games are quick and gameplay is simple. Makes it good for passing a brief bit of time, or binging if you like. Problem is a LOT of the trivia is misleading, misinterpreted, or just plain wrong. Seriously, there are a lot of inaccuracies. As quick and fun as it is each new incorrect "fact" saps away a bit of the joy.', 'I enjoyed the concept of this game for a couple days. Some of the questions were poorly worded, but I was willing to let it go. Then today I get "Are spiders harmful?" Obviously I selected yes it proceeds to tell me I was wrong, "Spiders are not harmful." This is false. Extremely false. Spiders are VERY harmful to insects. Plenty of humans have been harmed and even died from spiders. With that being said, they don\'t seek out to harm humans. This is true, but neither falling trees. Come on..', 'really good game however some of the questions are a bit too vague and have typing errors. also when you get one wrong it doesnt always tell you the actual answer, for example there was a question about whether a certain tree had a certain type of leaf and i got it wrong and it just said "it does not have said type of leaf" rather than saying what leaf it did have. also the dog belly button question is a bit silly because they only have belly buttons for a small period of time after birth', 'great concept but a lot of the trivia answers are flat out wrong, and some of the questions are very poorly or ambiguously worded. The developers should have an ingame option for users to rate questions or give feedback on question quality and answer accuracy. Here are a couple of examples - question: can elephants swim? game says no but a quick google search confirms that they can swim. question: are spiders harmful? game says no, but getting bit by a poisonous spider is harmful.', "To be fair, this game clearly wasn't designed by English speakers, and the translation is infinitely better than any of my own attempts to translate would be, but it is still really poorly translated. There shouldn't be so many double negatives in the questions. Also, as someone who does a lot of trivia, these questions aren't really skill-based. The best trivia games are ones that test knowledge which might have been accumulated for reasons other than doing well at trivia games...", 'Very addictive game, great time killer! My only ehh about this game is 90% of the time if you answer incorrectly they dont state why. They just re word the question. Examples: "is blank blank population over a certain amount?" -I get question wrong "blank blank population is over a certain amount" soo.. what is the population? "Are spiders harmful?" -I get question wrong "Spiders aren\'t harmful" Why!? I NEED TO KNOW. Other then that it\'s a great game though. Would totally recommend.', 'Its a good idea, I really like the idea of a trivia sort of battle royale, but the issue is the trivia. Some questions and answers don\'t line up with facts and even the actual reasoning it provides as to why. The other issue with the questions is when it says something like "This is over 50% blah blah", you answer true, but it\'s false because its actually over 75%. Well, if its above 75% it\'s also above 75%. In general the trivia questions need work, and a lot of it, but this game could be fun.', 'The concept is great and I can see how it could be addicting. The horrible grammar and misspelled words are the first things that really takes away its appeal, though. If you try to work past that, it gets worse when some of the answers they have listed are incorrect, which then makes you incorrect. I would think getting this far into creating the app those issues would be a considerably easy fix', "While the game is initially somewhat enjoyable, it quickly becomes uninteresting when you realize that you're just playing against AI, if you can even call it that. In the one hour I have played, I have seen MULTIPLE repeated questions, and on one occasion I had the same question back to back. There are plenty of typos and grammatical errors in the questions which is somewhat excusable, but sometimes the questions are worded with double negatives, causing unnecessary confusion. A bad trivia game"]

If you rule the local pub on trivia night, or just dream of the day you will, Sporcle is the perfect app for you. This popular quiz game for Android has got all the bells and whistles. More importantly, it's got great quizzes!

- A Quiz for Every Occasion
"Oh sure," you're thinking. "Another app with 10 or 15 lame quizzes." Au contraire! Sporcle for Android has thousands of inventive and challenging trivia games. Running the gamut from Entertainment to Religion, from Sports to Literature, there's a quiz here for anyone and everyone. You can browse through 15 different categories or simply select a random quiz and start playing.

Here's just a small sampling of the types of trivia tests you'll find on Sporcle: "50 Largest U.S. Cities." "Name that Sitcom." "Ancient Wonders." "Baby Names from Shakespeare." (?) "Guess Your NBA Team." "SNL Cast Blitz." "Famous Biologists." (??) And on and on.

These aren't your grandpa's multiple-choice quizzes, either--each one has a written answer that you must provide. As soon as you type the right answer, BING, it pops into the right spot.  When you type in a wrong answer however, the app just sits and stares at you, quietly judging you.  Play for time or play for fun, the decision is yours.

- How Do You Measure Up?
Sporcle scores your performance on every quiz and stores the information right in the app, so you can track which ones you've taken and how you did. You can also get more in-depth statistics on each game, seeing how your performance stacks up against others who have taken that quiz. And don't worry; each quiz reveals the correct answers once you've completed it, so you don't have to wonder. You can also take the same quiz again if you like.

- It Gets Better
One of the best things about Sporcle is the "connectivity" it provides. You can see comments from other players about each quiz and compare your score against theirs right on your phone--but that's just the beginning. You can then go online, create an account on Sporcle.com, and have even more fun. On the site you can comment on quizzes you've taken, rate them, view all kinds of statistics, invite and connect with your friends, post your results to Facebook and Twitter, and more. You can even create your own quiz.

Even if you just stick to the app, there's more than enough to keep you busy and entertained for a long while. It features thousands of quizzes pre-loaded in every category--and you don't have to have network access to play them. Just download the Android app and start exercising your brain. With Sporcle, there's always a new challenge waiting for you.

4 Player Reactor is the original fast, clean and funny reaction game for two to four players on the same device.

Challenge your friends (or enemies) to a multiplayer battle of reflexes, wits and knowledge! Great as a bar game, ice breaker or to decide who has to do the dishes.

One of 28 (we continuously add more) exciting mini-games is displayed on screen, and if you think the answer is correct, hit your button faster than your opponents to get a point. But be careful - hit it at the wrong time, and you'll lose one. After a few seconds, the next multiplayer challenge starts - and you can make up for lost points or extend your lead against your adversary!

---- Benefits of 4 Player Reactor: ----
28 (and growing) games with four difficulties each ranging from easy to insane -- that means over 100 combinations! A single-player training mode when you want to hone your skills for the next encounter, no advertisements whatsoever, and lots of extra settings for even more multiplayer fun!

---- Up to four players on the same device! ----
Nobody needs to wait, two, three or four players, one device, at the same time! Frantic multiplayer action is guaranteed for all ages! Some of the included mini-games require pure reaction, so the younger you are the better, while other mini-games require knowledge of countries in the world and puzzle-solving skills. Who can be the best in all of them?

---- Lots of dynamic Minigames! ----
There are 28 mini-games included, and they span all sorts of areas. For example: Who can find the sad face in a group of smiley faces? Does the shown capital city really belong to the country? Can the mouse navigate the maze to the cheese? Hit when the screen turns white! When is the changing labyrinth completed from corner to corner? Has the Countdown hit Zero? React when the Tic-Tac-Toe game is complete! And there's many more!

---- Old-School clean graphics ----
Sporting super-clean and slick graphics, 4 Player Reactor doesn't try to overwhelm or distract you with fancy effects or big explosions.This also means it runs on even the oldest and crankiest of Android devices! Everything in the game has been tested on all kinds of screens, and it runs beautifully on tablets! 

---- Settings to suit everyone! ----
There's a no-brainer "Quick Game" mode that allows you to jump right into the action. But if you hate math, or you only want to play that mode with the smiley faces, or you want a really really long game, you can change everything in the advanced settings menu! And if you're trying to learn a different language, we've got you covered: The game has been translated into 25 mysterious languages such as German, French, Chinese, Persian, Finnish, and many many more.

---- Independent developer team! -----
I'm an independent game developer and made the game all by myself - which explains the basic graphics (I like to think of them as clean ;)). I hope you like my game, and I totally crave your feedback, just send me an email at robin@coolcherrytrees.com.

column35: ['The game is pretty dang fun. I like to play it with my family and answer the many questions it has. The main issue I have the game is its ads and microtransactions. A minimalistic, beautifully designed visual puzzle game designed for the Pure Android experience.

With over 360 puzzles spread over 30 chapters, this game is sure to pull you in.
Best played with friends and family together. You will rediscover the delight and joy in solving puzzles together - huddled around a small screen for hours together with mesmerizing music.

In the beginning, human beings communicated only using symbols.
Language complicated things. Suddenly, there were many words to describe the same idea.

Think attempts to slowly teach the player to think visually and uses these learnings to construct more complicated ideas further into the game. Can you take a look at a bunch of images and figure out what ideas we are trying to communicate?

The game uses a smart, contextually aware hint system and AI which will guide you to the correct answer - instead of just opening out few letters on the keyboard as most other games do. You will find yourself having delightful conversations with the game and trying out various combinations - just to elicit a response from the AI.

To complement the beautiful visuals, the game features music by award winning composer Jim Guthrie (Indie Game the Movie and Sword & Sorcery).

With over 360 puzzles spread over 30 chapters, this game is sure to pull you in.
Best played with friends and family together. You will rediscover the delight and joy in solving puzzles together - huddled around a small screen for hours together.

A product of love from the proud stables of June Software Inc.

column35: ['The game is alright, it gets you thinking. My only issue is the points system need improvement. There should be bonus points for guessing all the answers without an error or hints. If you're not a movie buff, you won't get very far.", "Enjoyable. You're not overwhelmed with ads every time the screen changes. It could use more explanation of game play. And I don't see a counter for hints.", "It was great for a few days, i had 21 leavels unlocked and some at 100%. Then I come back today and all levels are locked except 1-4 which were all 100% but I had other levels at 100% so its totally unfair I'm unistalling NOW", 'brilliant, a game with a difference. hard but not so hard you feel stupid just hard enough to get the old brain ticking.', "Fun game, but couldn't give it a great review because it was so short. Blew through it in an afternoon.", 'Great game. Almost all pictures are great hints. Not difficult to win hints and they are helpful. You can beat levels easily, even without hints.', "It's fun. I was a little confused when tv shows popped up, but it's still great. A great way to pass time while waiting at the Dr or something.", 'New to game. Just learning that its not always a movie sometimes a tv program. Seems fun trying to get used to it.', "I have'nt played this app very much. However, I have enjoyed what I've played. Thank You for an enjoyable FREE game.", 'Great game for a movie fanatic like me, but not as easy as it looks. Coodos and two thumbs up! PJ', "I haven't found a movie trivia app yet that's very well thought out, interesting or well executed, this one is no different, par for the course.", 'Fun to work through, need to look at them more than once to figure them out!', 'Challenging without many of those annoying adverts between each answer! Great quiz', 'They game started easy enough but i find myself using more hints than i thought...great game!!!', 'Great but too short. And so far, not many ads', 'Great addictive app. Great app for long journeys.', "It's okay, but it'll trick me by mixing shows in there, and since I only watch a handful of shows, I usually get it completely wrong. It also has quite a few foreign films, which is fine, though one issue I have is when I do know the name, I end up spelling it wrong because it's in a different language. üò∞ Overall, it's worth wasting a few minutes every now and then.", 'Illustrations are often way too obscure.', "Great game, tolerable ads and not a lot of pressure to buy hints if you're a decent film buff. Only downside is I finished all the current levels in less than a week of playing off and on. Certainly addictive.", "Fun, addictive game. Good assortment of movies, from new ones to old ones. I don't have a lot of money, so it's nice to be able to earn hints instead of being forced to purchase them. Some of the clues are easy and some really make you think, so gets your brain and imagination working. Interface is nice and simple, so it's easy to cruise through. In my opinion, this is a super fun little game! Keep those levels coming, I'm anxiously awaiting the next set to come out. Thanks, creators!", "It's alright, not enough levels. once completed, (which movie buffs will do pretty quickly) you're stuck waiting to do a single daily question. * small letters makes spelling mistakes happen more than they should.", "The wheel that gives you free spin points, doesn't seem to be randomly spun? It seems to always give you the least points, ( never stops on anything higher than 3 ,so far). Annoying that you can't play it entirely offline. Even though your next pack is achieved, unless you open it b4 going offline, it won't let you play till back online. Some of the categories are a bit obscure, foreign films? It's pretty good otherwise", 'I like the idea of the game. However, the tiles are too small for the letters that are on them. The bottom part of the letters are cut off, so it makes it difficult to know whether you are choosing the right letter.', 'Just started playing. No issues yet.', 'Game was fun, but, way to easy. It only took me a few days to beat all 25 levels. I do watch a lot of movies though. Hopefully they add more levels.', 'Was enjoying the game, now unplayable as have been locked out of future levels and have already completed the previous ones. Game claims I must complete 20 questions to upgrade to level 4 (though I was previously level 12) although all questions have already been correctly answered. Shame, I really did enjoy the game, not just simple famous movies, contained some trickier questions which I liked as it kept me engaged. Hope this is fixed soon :)', 'Fun but bad graphic set up. The letters I, L E and others are cut off due to the ad banner on the bottom. Let me buy it I will because other than not knowing which lettet you are using it is a good game.', "Really great game. Doesn't cost anything. Lots of hints and tips. If you get stuck you can move on and return later. Love it!", "Great concept but way too easy. All levels from easy to difficult are fun. It is quite easy to earn points although the wheel is faulty since it was changed, as it often pays out on a lower number than should and the gaps are far too narrow.
